page.title: 12Brightwell Dairy Farm
page.content: I went to talk to the owner of {Brightwell Dairy Farm,} my grandad Mr L. Everex. He told me that he had been farming for 69 years and has been at Brightwell for 53 years. There are 80 milking cows which are worth about 500 pounds each. He has 5 gilts valued at 100 pounds each. A sow that is in pig is worth about 150 pounds. The pigs he breeds are a cross between Welsh and Large White, each pig can have a maximum of 15 piglets. The sows and gilt eat breeding nuts and fattening pigs eat pigmeal. On the farm there are four tractors which are used for many jobs such as carrying things and clearing up. (James Seymour)
